alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 8:54AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Clayton and Grant Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 853 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Prairieburg, or 11 miles north of Anamosa, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported up to 1" hail in Linn County at 837 am. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lancaster around 955 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Arthur, Highway 61 And County T, Montfort, Turkey River, Beetown, County Roads K And T, Fairview, Nelson Dewey State Park, Lancaster Municipal Airport and Blue River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
